associatedPollutants.TMDLEndPointText: IN THIS TMDL DOCUMENT, THE WATER QUALITY STANDARDS ARE THE INSTREAM GOALS.  THE TERM "TARGET CONCENTRATION" REFLECTS THE APPLICATION OF AN EXPLICIT MARGIN OF SAFETY (MOS) TO THE WATE QUALITY STANDARD.  SEE TMDL SECTION 5.4 FOR AN EXPLANATION OF MOS.  THE DESIGNATED USE CLASSIFICATION FOR WATERBODIES IN THE WATERSHED IS FISHING.  THE APPROPRIATE NARRATIVE WATER QUALITY STANDARD FOR EXCESS SEDIMENT IS DOCUMENTED IN GEORGIA'S RULES AND REGULATIONS FOR WATER QUALITY CONTROL, CHAPTER 391-3-6-.03(5)(C).  THIS FREE FROM NARRATIVE STANDARD IS THE BASIS FOR ESTABLISHING THE LEVEL OF SEDIMENT WHICH DOES NOT INTERFERE WITH THE "LEGITIMATE WATER USES."

associatedPollutants.TMDLEndPointText: IN THIS TMDL DOCUMENT, THE WATER QUALITY STANDARDS ARE THE INSTREAM GOALS.  THE TERM "TARGET CONCENTRATION" REFLECTS THE APPLICATION OF AN EXPLICIT MARGIN OF SAFETY (MOS) TO THE WATER QUALITY STANDARD.  SEE TMDL SECTION 5.4 FOR AN EXPLANATION OF MOS.  THE DESIGNATED USE CLASSIFICATION FOR WATERBODIES IN THE WATERSHED IS FISHING.  THE FECAL COLIFORM WATER QUALITY CRITERIA, FOR PROTECTION OF THE FISHING USE CLASSIFICATION, IS ESTABLISHED BY GEORGIA'S RULES AND REGULATIONS FOR WATER QUALITY CONTROL, CHAPTER 391-3-6.03(6)(C)(III)(GAEPD 2005).  THESE STANDARDS REQUIRE THAT A GEOMETRIC MEAN OF 200 CFU/100ML BE MAINTAINED FOR THE MONTHS MAY THROUGH OCTOBER.  IF THERE IS EVIDENCE THAT OCCASIONAL VIOLATIONS OF THIS GEOMETRIC MEAN ARE DUE TO NON-HUMAN SOURCES, THE ALLOWABLE GEOMETRIC MEAN CAN BE RAISED TO 500 CFU/100ML.  FOR THE MONTHS NOVEMBER THROUGH APRIL, THE STANDARD HAS BOTH A GEOMETRIC MEAN AND A MAXIMUM ALLOWABLE VALUE.  THE GEOMETRIC MEAN IS 1,000 CFU/100ML AND THE MAXIMUM VALUE IS 4,000 CFU/100ML.

THESE STANDARDS REQUIRE THAT A GEOMETRIC MEAN OF 200 CFU/100ML BE MAINTAINED FOR THE MONTHS MAY THROUGH OCTOBER.  IF THERE IS EVIDENCE THAT OCCASIONAL VIOLATIONS OF THIS GEOMETRIC MEAN ARE DUE TO NON-HUMAN SOURCES, THE ALLOWABLE GEOMETRIC MEAN CAN BE RAISED TO 500 CFU/100ML.  FOR THE MONTHS NOVEMBER THROUGH APRIL, THE STANDARD HAS BOTH A GEOMETRIC MEAN AND A MAXIMUM ALLOWABLE VALUE.  THE GEOMETRIC MEAN IS 1,000 CFU/100ML AND THE MAXIMUM VALUE IS 4,000 CFU/100ML.

Total Maximum Daily Load (TMDL) Evaluation for East Chickamauga Creek and Ivylog Creek in the Tennessee River Basin for Fecal Coliform

associatedPollutants.TMDLEndPointText: In this TMDL document, the water quality standards are the instream goals.  The term "target concentration" reflects the application of an explicit Margin of Safety (MOS) to the water quality standard.  See TMDL Section 5.4 for an explanation of MOS.  The designated use classification for waterbodies in the watershed is fishing.  The fecal coliform water quality criteria, for protection fo the fishing use classification, is established by Georgia's Rules and Regulations for Water Quality Control, Chapter 391-3-6-.03(6)(c)(iii)(GAEPD 2005).  These standards require that a geometric mean of 200 cfu/100mL be maintained for the months May through October.  If there is evidence that occasional violations of this geometric mean are due to non-human sources, the allowable geometric mean can be raised to 500 cfu/100mL.  For the months November through April, the standard has both geometric mean and a maximum allowable value.  The geometric mean is 1,000 cfu/100mL and the maximum value is 4,000 cfu/100mL.

These standards require that a geometric mean of 200 cfu/100mL be maintained for the months May through October.  If there is evidence that occasional violations of this geometric mean are due to non-human sources, the allowable geometric mean can be raised to 500 cfu/100mL.  For the months November through April, the standard has both geometric mean and a maximum allowable value.  The geometric mean is 1,000 cfu/100mL and the maximum value is 4,000 cfu/100mL.

actions.actionName: Total Maximum Daily Load (TMDL)  Evaluation for Ogeechee Creek in the Ogeechee River Basin for Dissolved Oxygen

associatedPollutants.TMDLEndPointText: In this TMDL document, the water quality standards are the instream goals.  The term "target concentration" reflects the application of an explicit Margin of Safety (MOS) to the water quality standard.  See TMDL Section 5.4 for an explanation of MOS.  The designated use classification for waterbodies in the watershed is fishing.  The appropriate narrative water quality standard for dissolved oxygen is documented in Georgia's Rules and Regulations for Water Quality Control, Chapter 391-3-6-03(6)(c)(i) and .03(7) for Natural Water Quality.  The warm water fishery criteia are a 5.0 mg/L daily average and a minimum of 4.0 mg/L.  The Natural Water Quality provision allows GA Environmental Protection Division (EPD) to set the dissolved oxygen criteria at 90 percent of the natural dissolved oxygen stream condition.

Georgia's Water Quality Standard for PCBs is expressed in Georgia's Rules and Regulations for Water Quality Control, Chapter 391-3-6, revised November 2005.  Georgia's REgulation 391-3-6-.03(5)(e)(iv) states that "in-stream concentrations of the following chemical constituents listed by the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency as toxic priority pollutants pursuant to Section 307(a)(1) of the Federal Clean Water Act (as amended) shall not exceed criteria indicated below under annual average or higher stream flow conditions." Woodhall Creek TMDL for Copper, Lead, and Zinc

associatedPollutants.TMDLEndPointText:
The TMDL targets for Copper, Lead, and Zinc are derived from the State water quality standards regulations at Chapter 391-3-6-0.03(5)(e)(ii).  Using the formulas for accounting for stream hardness, the following site specific targets were derived:
Copper - Chronic toxicity 4.1 ug/L at 0.16 MGD critical flow
Lead - Chronic toxicity 0.9 ug/L at 0.16 MGD critical flow
Zinc - Acute toxicity 53.9 ug/L at 0.15 MGD critical flow

The TMDL targets for Copper, Lead, and Zinc are derived from the State water quality standards regulations at Chapter 391-3-6-0.03(5)(e)(ii).  Using the formulas for accounting for stream hardness, the following site specific targets were derived:
Copper - Chronic toxicity 4.1 ug/L at 0.16 MGD critical flow
Lead - Chronic toxicity 0.9 ug/L at 0.16 MGD critical flow
Zinc - Acute toxicity 53.9 ug/L at 0.15 MGD critical flow

The TMDL targets for Copper, lead, and Zinc are derived from the State water quality standards regulations at Chapter 391-3-6-0.035(5)(e)(ii).  Using the formulas for accounting for stream hardness, the following site specific targets were derived:
Copper - Chronic toxicity 4.1 ug/L at 0.16 MGD critical flow
Lead - Chronic toxicity 0.9 ug/L at 0/16 MGD critical flow
Zinc - Acute toxicity 53.9 ug/L at 0.15 MGD critical flow
The more conservative of the acute or chronic toxicity values was used to establish the TMDL target.
